topic: How to refactor WASM targets using fastapi with Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: How to refactor WASM targets using fastapi with Python 3.12+

response_parsed.title: Refactoring WebAssembly (WASM) Targets Using FastAPI with Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide demonstrates how to refactor WebAssembly (WASM) targets using FastAPI, a modern, fast (high-performance), web framework for building APIs with Python 3.12+.
key_points: Leverage the new features and performance improvements provided by Python 3.12 in your WASM applications.
Integrate FastAPI for building efficient, scalable, and high-performance web APIs.
Compile Python code into WebAssembly (wasm) for running on the web or other environments without a Python runtime.
version_notes: This guide is specifically tailored for Python 3.12+, as it includes features and improvements not available in earlier versions.
caveats: Ensure you have Pyodide installed (an open-source project that enables running Python in the browser via WebAssembly) to run and test your FastAPI WASM app.
Some complex Python libraries may not be compatible with WebAssembly, so choose appropriate dependencies for your WASM targets.
